instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bootloop (but sometimes turns on)
threads.message:
It had Liquid damage all over it.
The Fan spins for 1 sec and stops. Then it starts again, to do the same thing over and over again. Sometimes (Especially if we start it for the first time after a long time) it boots, no problem whatsoever.
We already replaced EFI chip after ultrasonicing it, bot no success.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bootloop (but sometimes turns on)
threads.message: See if starts in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bootloop (but sometimes turns on)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bootloop (but sometimes turns on)
threads.message:
Remove battery, unplug charger, press power button, plug charger and maintain power button pressed 5-10s.
You can use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads instead of power button...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bootloop (but sometimes turns on)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bootloop (but sometimes turns on)
threads.message:
"Fanspin steady"
So board stays on in SMC bypass, but not working?
Did you test USB activity?
Check if all big coils get voltage.
